criterion_text: Any positive test result for hepatitis B or C indicating acute or chronic infection and/or detectable virus

Negative hepatitis C virus (HCV) antibody test at screening, or positive HCV antibody test followed by a negative HCV RNA test at screening. The HCV RNA test will be performed only for patients who have a positive HCV antibody test.
Known positive serology for HIV.
Positive serologic evidence of current infectious liver disease including Hepatitis B viral antibody IGM, Hepatitis B surface antigen, Hepatitis C virus antibody and HIV
Active hepatitis B or C infection determined by serology and/or nucleic acid testing (NAT)
positive for HIV, Hep-C or Hep-B surface antigen and malignancy.
Positive hepatitis C serology or active hepatitis B infection.
Positive for hepatitis C virus (HCV), hepatitis B surface antigen (HBsAg) and known history of HIV, malignancy, active infection and cardiovascular diseases (CVs)
Known history of hepatitis B or C infection or known positive test for hepatitis B surface antigen or core antigen, or hepatitis C polymerase chain reaction (PCR)
A positive Hepatitis B surface antigen test result. Patients with Hepatitis C Virus (HCV) infection may be included if all other liver function eligibility criteria are met.
Known active hepatitis B and/or hepatitis C infection
Evidence of either cirrhosis or stage 3-4 liver fibrosis in patients with chronic hepatitis C or positive hepatitis C serology.
Negative Hepatitis B surface antigen (HBsAg) or Negative HBV DNA PCR
Patients with evidence of chronic active Hepatitis B (positive for HbsAg) and Hepatitis C (positive for viral RNA).
Known human immunodeficiency virus (HIV-1) infection or chronic hepatitis B, or C (Hep B serology positive without active infection will be eligible)
Has a known active hepatitis B or hepatitis C
Active hepatitis B or hepatitis C infection.
Known HIV-positive serology.
Active hepatitis B or C viral infection or hepatitis B surface antigen positive

True positive test results for hepatitis A (Immunoglobulin M (IgM) positive). Subjects with a history of hepatitis A with Immunoglobulin G (IgG) blood test are not excluded. True positive test results hepatitis B, or C infection.
Active hepatitis B or hepatitis C with abnormal liver function tests; HIV positive patients receiving antivirals.
Presence of hepatitis B surface antigen (HBsAg), positive hepatitis C antibody test result at screening or within 3 months prior to first dose of study treatment.
Positive serology for HIV, hepatitis B virus (HBV) or HCV.
Positive serology for HIV; Hepatitis B/C Antigen
positive HIV antibody test or hepatitis serologies
Mother's serology test results are negative for HIV, Hepatitis B, and Hepatitis C.
Hepatitis B surface antigen negative and hepatitis C antibody negative
Hepatitis B/C blood test must be done at screening for all patients. Patients who test positive for Hepatitis C antibodies and the Hepatitis B antigen are ineligible.
Positive for Hepatitis B or C
Active Hepatitis B infection (Hep B surface antigen positive)
Positive hepatitis A, B antigen, or C or HIV test at screening.
History of HIV infection or known positive serology
Negative hantavirus PsVNA test result at screening
Positive Hepatitis Serology (Hep. B antigen+ or Hep. C antibody+)
Positive hepatitis serology
Patients positive for Hepatitis (Hepatitis A history excepted)
Known or active hepatitis B or C with abnormal liver function tests
Positive confirmatory test for HIV infection.
Positive HIV or HTLV-1 serology
